title: Want Need Have
name: Want Need Have
description:
A Map by Iad2la

The Want Need Have map is all about the clothing stores we love. And no, this isn't some database. These are stores I've browsed, frequented, or dropped some of my own hard-earned cash. 

The best way to keep these locations current is for you to comment, so let us know if you love the stores, too. And soon I'll open up the map so you can add your own places. 

Check out the Want Need Have blog for the spin on e-tail, retail, and the fashion industry at large http://wantneedhave.blogspot.com/

properties.name: A B fits
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 40 Grant Ave., San Francisco, CA 94108The downtown/Union Sq. store of the A B fits in North Beach has a killer collection of mens and womens denim (so many big labels, so little time to mention them all), as well as ETRO accessories (deeeelish) and urbanite faves: L.A.M.B., Paul & Joe, Paul Smith, Rebecca Taylor, Hussien Chalayan... Oh and these smart people even have a blog: http://www.abfits.com/shoptalk/ Love that!

properties.name: A B fits
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 1519 Grant Ave., San Francisco, CA 94133Killer collection of mens and womens denim (so many big labels, so little time to mention them all), as well as ETRO accessories (deeeelish) and urbanite faves: L.A.M.B., Paul & Joe, Paul Smith, Rebecca Taylor, Hussien Chalayan... Oh and these smart people even have a blog: http://www.abfits.com/shoptalk/ Love that!

properties.name: Agent Provocateur
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la54 Geary Street, San Francisco, CA This global lingerie chain has all the bells a whistles, frills and thrills.

properties.name: Bulo
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la418 Hayes Street, san francisco 94102Bulo means hip, attractive, and new. It also refers to the state of being happy and ease. For 11 years, Perella\'s two Hayes Valley shops have been delivering the promise of their name. Bulo introduces SF style-mongers to the latest footwear fashions and accessories, imported every three weeks from England, Spain & Italy\'s boutique labels.

properties.name: Burnt Sugar
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 601 N 35th St, Seattle 98103 This is the one-stop shop for affordable hostess gifts and stocking-fillers come the holidays. From cute and kitsch bits and bobs to higher-priced jewelry, bags and more.

properties.name: Celebrity Closet Raiders
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 9157 Sunset Blvd., 90069They raid celeb closets and feed the fashion food chain. Find major markdowns on designer duds from all over the globe. Shelves and shelves of denim!

properties.name: Curve
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la154 N. Robertson blvd, los angeles, ca 90048Favorite fashion spot for young starlets and style indisers.

properties.name: Delirious Shoes
properties.description: Posted by Fritz 317 Connecticut St, San Francisco, CAThis pretty little Potrero shop carries unique designer shoes, handbags, and accessories. You can almost always find a steal on the sales table in the back, and the proprietress, Amy, is a very nice lady. Pick up a new pair of heels and go to Collage Gallery down the street for jewelry.

properties.name: Dema
properties.description: Posted by Fritz 1038 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Denim Bar
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la1101 South Joyce Street, Arlington, VAHigh styling and rarefied jeans at this trove of all things denim. Mens and womens, skirts, jackets, and the odd accessory. Great staff ... so when are they getting a liquor license?

properties.name: Denim Bar
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la1101 South Joyce Street., 22202small, hip-looking shop with a big agenda and lots of appealing women\'s fashions from the then-not-so-well-known names of Trina Turk, Cynthia Rowley, Tocca, Kors, Theory and Urchin, as well as some more outre (and expensive) pieces from Vivienne Westwood and Chloe. And a lotta jeans. Farinelli reminds, "I was the first one to carry Earl jeans."

properties.name: Diane Von Furstenberg The Shop
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 8407 melrose ave., 90069What is there left to say? The woman created the wrap dress and made daytime dressing a foolproof game.

properties.name: Emeralds
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 624 N. Lamar Blvd., Austin, TX 78703Women\'s clothing, shoes, jewelry, accessories, bath and body, home accents, stationery ... it\'s something of a treasure trove. We got tipped off by WNH reader Janie about this fabulous store. The website is great, too -- I especially love the selection of candles.

properties.name: Filly
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 8032 west 3rd St., Los angeles, ca 90048Despite the name and signage, it’s not all equestrian stuff for horsey girls. Awesome jewelry with a playful antique feel and a great collection of must-have silhouettes from jersey to knitwear, shoes and accessories.

properties.name: Footcandy
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 1239 Main St., St. Helena, caIf you\'re in wine country, youll need some fancy footwear, not to stomp the grapes but to work the crowds in. Put your right foot forward with designer shoes. Oh and the store opens at 11am daily, so that should give you enough time to shake off that hangover.

properties.name: Girl Stuff
properties.description: Posted by System 2255 Polk Street, San Francisco, CA, 94109Girl Stuff 415-409-2426

properties.name: Heist
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 1104 Abbot Kinney Blvd., Venice, CA 90291Nilou Ghodsi calls her store "a bigger version of my own closet." That must be one sleek, airy and fabulous closet. Not only is this store in a truly fabulous shopping location (who\'d have thought blocks from the beach could be this chic?) the owner follows up with personal thank you notes. Now that\'s just classy.

properties.name: Hu's Shoes
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la3005 M Street NW, Washington DCFashion-forward footwear in a gloriously clean and airy store. Big names like Chloe, Marc Jacobs, Proenza Schouler, Sonia Rykiel, and Viktor&Rolf don\'t come cheap. But they are pretty.

properties.name: Hysteria
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 125 S. Fairfax St., Alexandria, VA, 22314Diane vonFurstenberg, LAMB, Autumn Cashmere, Development, Trina Turk, Chaiken, Cacharel, Phillip Lim ... tra la la (that\'s music to our ears, right?)

properties.name: Intermix
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la365 Bleecker Street, 10014Intermix is a chain store these days but they\'ve mastered the fine art of keeping a small store feel to a big budget operation. The Intermix look is all about what\'s hot and what\'s now, stocking our favorite big names as well as emerging womenswear designers.

properties.name: Lacoste
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la575 Madison Ave., New York, NY 10022 The preppy Lacoste look is enjoying a major resurgence amongst urbanites across the nation. Despite its lofty Midtown Manhattan address, the staff are super-sweet and if you\'ve only got an hour to grab lunch during a hectic day of business meetings, why not grab a sandwich at Dean & Deluca then stock up on tees and tops right here, right around the corner.

properties.name: Last Chance Boutique
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la8712 Washington Blvd., Culver City, CA 90232It\'s like every day\'s a sample sale. Last Chance allows designers to unload last seasons merchandise and overstock in order to provide boutique shoppers a trendy and affordable outlet store. Boutique owner Samira Arkel has all the connections. All you need is an hour or so to kill and an eye for a major bargain.

properties.name: Les Amis
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 3420 Evanston Ave N., Seattle, WA 98103DVF, Nanette Lepore, Trina Turk ... it\'s like your cool older sister\'s closet.

properties.name: Let's Go
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la7863 Girard Avenue, La Jolla, CAThe shoes, shirts and shapes you want now. Everything from heels, sneaks and flip-flops; dresses, skirts and tees. Mens and womenswear in the heart of La Jolla.

properties.name: Lisa Kline - Lisa Kline Men
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la123 South Robertson Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA, 90048The place to shop for designer looks -- great celeb spotting, too. Menswear and womenswear within walking distance in this hot hot LA \'hood.

properties.name: London Sole
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la1331 Montana Avenue, Santa Monica, CA, 90403A little bit of Britain brings newness to balet flats, loafers and slippers. OK, OK, we mainly just love it for those round toe flats in every color and print.

properties.name: Miss Sixty
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 1239 Wisconsin Ave NW, Washington, 20007Miss Sixty has established itself as one of the must-have \'every day\' brand names gracing our wardrobes. This Georgetown store is roomy, the staff are helpful without being annoying, and the music is generally good.

properties.name: Niche and Niche Child
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la621 W Fir St., San Diego, CA 92101 In a light and airy studio on charming Fir Street in Little Italy, you can unload some serious cash as you load up on the latest looks by Marc Jacobs, Peter Kent, BCBG and Puma. In this relaxed atmosphere, shoes and not strewn out by stressed sales assistants or needy customers, and if need be, they\'ll stay open late just for you. While the products are high-end, the store is free of pomp and posture.

properties.name: Ped
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 1115 First Avenue, seattle, waThey are actually closing and re-opening in September with a new name, but the COOLEST shoes in the city. Audley, Blay, Lisa Nading, Gentle Souls, Chie Mihara, 12th St. Shoes ... ooh the list!

properties.name: Pop
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 1803 A 14th St., NW Washington DC 20009I love this store! Great finds for men and women and lots of accessories... all very affordable and right on trend-target.

properties.name: Proper Topper
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 3213 P st, NW, washington, dc 20007Way more than hats and accessories, this Georgetown store now carries Ted Baker women\'s. Oh and the sales staff are just adorable.

properties.name: Proper Topper
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 1350 connecticut ave., NW, washington, dc 20036Your friends may tell you it\'s just a hat store but with the recent addition of selling the Ted Baker women\'s line, you\'ll find wardrobe essentials as well as jewelry and other trinkets.

properties.name: Sassanova
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 1641 Wisconsin Ave. NW washington dcThe shop, all chocolate and pink with cheetah carpet and crystal chandeliers, will carry shoe lines including Michael Kors, Sigerson Morrison, Beverly Feldman, and Lily Holt; handbags from Rafe New York, Lorelei and Lauren Merkin; and jewelry from Femmegemes. store hours: mon, tues, wed, fri, sat, 10-6 thursday, 10-7 sunday, 12-5

properties.name: ShoeFly
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la2618 Wilson Blvd., Arlington, VA 22201The prettiest, must-have shoes, bags and a good collection of fun and funky jewelry.

properties.name: ShoeFly
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la822 Elmwood Ave., Buffalo, NY 14222The prettiest, must-have shoes, bags and a good collection of fun and funky jewelry.

properties.name: South Moon Under
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la2700 Clarendon Blvd. arlington, vaStocking many of the minor labels we love, South Moon Under is a trove of comfortable cottons, hot denim, sweet swimwear and the season\'s key pieces... whatever the season. Great place for gifts-for-girlfriends, too (jewelry, frames et al.)

properties.name: Starrs Womens Clothing
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la Dolores St & Ocean Ave., Carmel, CA 93923Carrying the cutest, hand-picked must haves. Call 831-622-9755 for hours.

properties.name: Tabletop
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la  1608 20TH STREET NW., washington, dc 20009Specializing in lamps, bowls, mid-century inspired casual chairs, bags and jewelry, Tabletop is a fantastic one-stop, especially when you\'re after a unique gift for a stylish friend.

properties.name: Ted Baker
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la131 North Robertson Blvd. 90048The quintessential mens and womenswear designer bringing British style to US markets. Everything from sleek suits, crisp shirts, and comfortable tees, hoodies with the tongue-in-cheek Ted Baker trademark. Great for wallets, belts and cufflinks.

properties.name: The District Line
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 2118 18th Street NW, Washington DCModern English fashion. Carrying the Best of British, mainly menswear.

properties.name: Tininha's Butique de Biquini
properties.description: Posted by Iad2la 617 N 35th St. Seattle, Washington Swimwear that suits you. Friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff. Giselle\'s got nuthin\' on us now!
